titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Frank Henry Schultz photograph collection. 2016071 Aa 1
titlestmt.author: Finding aid created by Sarah Lebovitz, September 2016.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-05-02 16:11:11 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Corporal in Company B, 310th. Engineer Regiment during the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes photographs of Shultz and Shultz's family.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open without restriction.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by James J. Bloedorn (donor no. 11593) in August, 2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frank Henry Shultz was born to German immigrant parents Johann H. Shultz and Lise Lempke Shultz on April 25, 1888 in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. He was appointed as a United States Army corporal in the Company B, 310th. Engineer Regiment in 1918, and participated in the 1918 Polar Bear Expedition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of three photographs. One is a photographic postcard of Frank Henry Shultz, taken in Archangel Russia during the expedition. One is a photocopy of a Shultz family photo, which includes Frank's mother, Frank's sister Minnie Schultz Chromasta and neice Hazel Chromasta, and Frank's father. The third is a photocopy of another family photo, including Frank's mother, Frank's neices Grace Vierheilig and Hazel Chromasta, and nephew William Vierheilig.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Donor(s) have transferred any applicable copyright to the Regents of the University of Michigan but the collection may contain third-party materials for which copyright was not transferred. Patrons are responsible for determining the appropriate use or reuse of materials.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Frank Henry Schultz photograph collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan. [URL]
